segments.text: I see the woman standing by the sink with a sense of purpose, but it feels misplaced in this moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water cascading over the edge of the sink is a loud reminder of her distraction.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can hardly look away from the boy on the stool; he’s like a cartoon character about to fall off.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s surprising how much mischief can happen in an otherwise ordinary kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s expectant posture is endearing; I can almost hear her thoughts, 'Just one cookie!'
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But the thought of them being scolded if they get caught is equally strong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The combination of spilt water and stolen cookies creates a recipe for disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight streaming through the window only highlights how trapped they are in this moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if the woman turns around? What if someone slips before they even get a cookie?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s an innocent act, really, but the stakes feel so high in this precarious kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR
